title: Interactive Exercise: Build a Safe List Accessor
description:
Create a function that safely accesses a list element by index. Handle multiple types of errors:
- IndexError if index is out of range
- TypeError if index is not an integer
- Use else block to print success message
- Use finally block to log the attempt

**Your task:**
1. Create a try block that accesses the list at the given index
2. Add except block for IndexError
3. Add except block for TypeError
4. Add else block for successful access
5. Add finally block to log the attempt

**Test with:** my_list = [10, 20, 30, 40, 50]

**Starter code:**

testCases.description: Error message for out of range index

hints.text: Structure: try → access items[index] → except IndexError → except TypeError → else → finally. Remember to set result in the try block!

commonMistakes.correction: Add : at the end of the line
